domainproperty.name: Authorised account removal
domainproperty.definition: Deletion of OpenID account out of scope

domainproperty.name: OpenID lock-out recovery
domainproperty.definition: OpenID account recovery procedure is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: App running in widget renderer
domainproperty.definition: There are no approved widget renderers.

domainproperty.name: Application blacklist checks
domainproperty.definition: webinos supported app stores are out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Widget data authorisation
domainproperty.definition: Although applications shall only access data permitted by the underlying system, circumventing cross-origin resource sharing restrictions via native application access to application data is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Application developer signing key storage
domainproperty.definition: Keys are currently saved in $HOME/.webinos. If we use the keyring, platform applications can access contained keys once keyring is unlocked

domainproperty.name: Application QoS
domainproperty.definition: We have no way of asserting how an application's quality of service expectations might be expressed or satisfied.

domainproperty.name: Usage data sharing restriction
domainproperty.definition: Because there are several ways applications can share data, including server-side out of band methods, usage sharing restrictions are out of scope. However, privacy policies can explain what an application proposes to do with user supplied data, which may allow users to make informed choices at install time.

domainproperty.name: User password authorisation
domainproperty.definition: While we can recommend safe OpenID providers and make recommendations, controlling how OpenID providers are run is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: OpenID authorisation
domainproperty.definition: webinos should use PAPE extension and set max_auth_age=0 in order to prevent authentication caching

domainproperty.name: Manual personal zone enrolment.
domainproperty.definition: Manual personal zone enrolment is circumvented by the latest specification which allows in-band authentication.

domainproperty.name: Trust information.
domainproperty.definition: Recommending what might be sufficient information to identify prospective malware is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Best-practice policy
domainproperty.definition: The default policy is only a static template rather than anything specific to a device or personal zone.

domainproperty.name: Browser API unauthorised
domainproperty.definition: Forbidding access to browser-provided APIs is not possible without specifying a webinos specific browser.

domainproperty.name: Credentials change authorisation.
domainproperty.definition: Changing OpenID credentials out of scope

domainproperty.name: Secret RPC Call Log
domainproperty.definition: Misusing the secrecy of the context database can be misused for this purpose. However, context logging is turned off by default and must be requested with permissions.

domainproperty.name: Pseudonymous API user identifier
domainproperty.definition: Pseudonymous identifiers are currently not supported.

domainproperty.name: Memorable credentials
domainproperty.definition: The creation of memorable credentials for managing PZHs is not mandated.

domainproperty.name: Installed app XHR non-repudiation
domainproperty.definition: While use of W3C WARP or Mozilla's Content Security Policy can achieve this non-repudiation, this is not explicitly supported by webinos.

domainproperty.name: Application use authenticy
domainproperty.definition: Verifying the authenticity of prospective malware is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Personal data unauthorised to trusted apps
domainproperty.definition: Controlling whether or not webinos applications may be trusted with personal data is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Installed application behaviour cannot be interfered with
domainproperty.definition: Protecting the integrity of the application packages and isolation / freedom from influence by other entities is not currently supported.

domainproperty.name: Installed app content injection tests
domainproperty.definition: Control over browser based widget renderers is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Immutable webinos modules
domainproperty.definition: There are no File API restrictions for accessing webinos code modules

domainproperty.name: Verified webinos.js
domainproperty.definition: Verifying webinos.js is out of scope while webinos supports web browsers and web apps must include their own webinos.js file. Having a common include path for webinos.js may be an improvement, or replacing this approach in a browser model.

domainproperty.name: Prevent javascript from other domains
domainproperty.definition: Preventing hosted applications from being vulnerable from JavaScript injection is out of scope. Various approaches can protect against attacks on the client side, such as CSP restrictions, but these are not implemented.

domainproperty.name: Verified injected javascript
domainproperty.definition: Verification against code injection is not currently implemented for webinos.js and javascript from other domains.

domainproperty.name: Verified background application
domainproperty.definition: While we can recommend the use of app stores with verified applications and suggest the setting of sensible default policies, satisfying this goal is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Malicious code unevaluated
domainproperty.definition: There are no restrictions within event handlers for executing JSON.

domainproperty.name: Trusted NDEF message content
domainproperty.definition: There are no restrictions planned on how NDEF messages shall be processed within webinos.

domainproperty.name: Plugin verification
domainproperty.definition: Control over browser based widget renderers is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Verification before installation
domainproperty.definition: While we can recommend the use of app stores with verified applications, satisfying this goal is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Native malware not running
domainproperty.definition: webinos makes no assurances about a potentially compromised platform.

domainproperty.name: Password brute force resistance
domainproperty.definition: OpenID credentials' details, which are a secret shared between OpenID providers and users, are out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Password recovery resistance
domainproperty.definition: OpenID account recovery procedure is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Policy validation
domainproperty.definition: Supporting the user validation of policy files is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: PZH admin URL displayed prominently
domainproperty.definition: While a customised browser could present additional GUIs which authenticate the PZH to the user in a more visible way, control over browser displays is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: PZH Admin URL well known
domainproperty.definition: While recommendations can be made for how admin URLs should be formatted, we cannot control the format of URLs, which users are bad at parsing.

domainproperty.name: Human-readable PZH admin URL
domainproperty.definition: We cannot control the format of URLs but the specifications should recommend their format.

domainproperty.name: Single personal zone proxy
domainproperty.definition: There are currently no explicit checks for instances of multiple PZP configuration data on a single device.

domainproperty.name: Test API disabled
domainproperty.definition: There are no supported means for distinguishing test APIs from those which are officially supported. We do, however, intend to impose a naming scheme that will enable the disabling of test API's in installation environment, either when packaging/building webinos or on install time.

domainproperty.name: Test configuration disabled
domainproperty.definition: There are no supported means for distinguishing test and sample configuration data from valid platform or application data. But we intend to impose a naming scheme that will enable the disabling of test and sample configuration in installation environment, either when packaging/building webinos or on install time.

domainproperty.name: Unspoofable PZH admin URLs
domainproperty.definition: Control over URLs visited by browsers is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Webinos backdoor tests
domainproperty.definition: Testing for the presence of backdoors is not currently within scope. Gatekeeping processes are currently being considered for change requests which will consider the potential for such backdoors being introduced.

domainproperty.name: Widget processor verification
domainproperty.definition: Widget processors are not part of the webinos system specification.

domainproperty.name: Authorised widget renderer extensions
domainproperty.definition: Security of the widget renderers is out of scope.

domainproperty.name: Hosted app XSS resistance
domainproperty.definition: Security of hosted applications is out of scope.
